website_summaries.verdict: A super light and durable all-weather tent. Comes at a price that won't stress your budget.
pros: We love this traditional A-frame backpacking tent
It weighs less than 3 pounds and packs down small
Has mesh doors and a venting system for keeping cool in the heat and evaporating moisture overnight
Wide enough to store gear inside the tent overnight
Trekking poles or sticks can be used for setup
cons: This tent uses trekking poles in the setup, which might already be part of your gear

website_summaries.verdict: A great little all-weather tent designed to be compact and lightweight for hiking and camping.
pros: A great value on a reliable backpacking tent
A good length at over 7 feet long
Can be tied in between trees if needed
Includes mesh doors to keep bugs out
Doors provide a decent air flow in hot weather
Tent retains heat in cold weather
cons: Requires trekking poles or other sticks for setup

customer_reviews.title: Great Ultralight Tent
customer_reviews.text: Very Ultralight tent. Well made, good quality for the price. My 9 year old son and I used it backpacking in Yosemite. We had plenty of room. I am 5'10" and weigh 170lbs. Definately recommend keeping doors open otherwise you will get lots of condensation build up on the inside and your sleeping bag will get soaked. Just keep the mesh screen closed. I made that mistake the 1st night. Also the tent stakes are heavy duty but a little on the heavy side weighing in at 1oz each, so I got ultralight aluminum stakes that weigh 0.5 ounce and uses only 6 stakes instead of the 11 that it came with to lighten my load. Definately Recommend
customer_reviews.author: N. Hawa

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I've used so far.
customer_reviews.text: Used on our recent trip to the petrified forest backcountry. There were really high winds sweeping up dust storms and threatening to sweep away all our supplies all night but the tent didn't budge with just the trekking pole's tips inserted into the top and resting the handle on the ground. I was able to set it up by myself no problem while my husband made sure no other supplies were blown away. Kept the heat out during the hottest point of the day and was big enough for 2 adults plus both our packs and shoes. Super durable and resilient; lightweight and compact. Can't recommend this tent enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Lotus Aromatherapy

customer_reviews.title: This tent is very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very easy to set up, is made from high-quality material and is waterproof. As with any tent, you can expect condensation inside of you are in a humid environment. This tent is well made and fits easily into even the smallest of backpacks. You simply cannot beat the price on this great piece of gear, it is much nicer than the big name brand ones I own, but costs only a fraction of the price. This is a must have piece of equipment for any camping enthusiast or survivalist.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought it over the winter, put it up for the first time last night. Half drunk and in the dark and found it quite easy. Pitched it next to a river, left the screens open and had minimal condensation issues. Good deal imo
customer_reviews.author: Brien

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight Backpacking, I Think Not
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great for the budget camper/hiker. I guess there is no way around buying a decent ultralight backpacing/hiking/camping tent. This tent I good, sets up nice but night tight, does not breath well though. Its roomy enough for two grown adults and I'm 6'4", 250lbs. 8 did not test the rain in it but I set it up during a week long rain here in the Pacific NorthWest and it was dry inside. If your looking for a very reasonable price budget tent, get this. If your a serious hiking or backpacker, skip it and pay up for a solid name brand ultralight tent.
customer_reviews.author: TONY PROIETTE

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product ad finally got around to testing it 2 nights this weekend. The material, and zippers were solid, especially for such a budget tent. It’s easy to setup, lightweight, and roomy. Unfortunately I woke up to a wet sleeping bag due to condensation issues. I had the back vents and front door part open and still had issues. The 2.2 option might be better but I’m not sure I’d trust the company product design in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Claustrophobic!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great tent for my backpacking trip this past weekend. I was wrong. I felt so claustrophobic. I couldnt sit up and and when I tried to roll up my sleeping bag it was a fight with the tent. I’m only 5’5”. I bought this for my boyfriend and I to camp in and he’s 6’2”. First thing when I got home I told him we need a different tent. It’s roomy side to side but sitting up is a different story. I wish I could return this. Only good thing is it’s super compact and fit in my backpack perfectly. I’d suggest spend the money on something with a bit more head room.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I can't find a single bad thing to say about this tent. I used it alone, had plenty of space, and was comfortable. It was a breeze to set up with my trekking poles, and I switched one out for a big stick so I could use one pole for a hike. Very little condensation accumulated, just near my head. No dripping, seemed well-ventilated even though I chose to leave the vents closed due to cold temps. Didn't even notice its weight, and used Tyvek also bought via Amazon for a footprint. Great, lightweight combo.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Homebody

customer_reviews.title: Just hope it doesn't rain!
customer_reviews.text: Good weight: Very light. Pitched next to my back patio for test and picked up a quart of water in the tent on all sides and ends. Not Waterproof or Water resistant
customer_reviews.author: Charles Falk

customer_reviews.title: One season tent!
customer_reviews.text: Condensation a big problem. Do not use in wet conditions. Once condensation develops and if rain continues you and you stuff will be soaking wet. The pressure outside from dripping or rain causes the condensation to fall inside. Needs more ventilation and air flow. Was easy to put up and take down and fold.
customer_reviews.author: GDM

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking Hunting Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent on a 4 day hunting trip into the backcountry. It performed as expected. There was plenty of room for me and my pack. It did not rain on my trip so I can't speak to the waterproof efficiency but I did spray waterproof sealer on all seams prior to using. The only issue I experienced is the screen netting at times tends to stick to the velcro of the door flap. The netting is very lightweight so you have to be careful when separating it from the velcro. My netting didn't tear but I could see after several uses this may be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Heads up
customer_reviews.text: We loved the light weight of this tent. We bought trekking poles separately and they work perfectly with the tent. Really the only issue we had was a problem with condensation on the inside of the tent. We were hiking the Pacific crest Trail and nighttime temps were about 50°F . When we awakened the entire tent surface on the inside was moist and efforts to leave the tent partially open to ventilate better were never successful for us. I don’t know if it would have been better with one person instead of two.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nope all is good. thing has a heavy duty floor
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how you can give less than 5 stars when you consider the weight to cost ratio for this tent. For $50 the first thing I did was inspect all the seams and grommets. I really expected to to run some thread over a spot or two. Nope all is good. thing has a heavy duty floor, decent sides and a weight you can't get near for under $200 normally. I was going to get a few more for the kid's boy scout troop but alas they are currently unavailable.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for bikepacking!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is exactly what I've been looking for in a bikepacking tent. lightweight, packs tiny, and has a lot of space inside when the tent is up. Most lightweight tents I've come across use poles that have segments that are too long to stuff into panniers or bikepacking bags. Since this tent doesn't require anything special for poles, I was able to make my own lightweight aluminum poles with really short segments so that I can fit them in my bikepacking bags a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: MadCityMike

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This is well made. It is a single wall trekking pole tent, but the materials used and quality of the construction are excellent. The only thing I would change on the design is to have the same door set up on both sides rather than the one door and rear wall venting system that is on it now. It would make it to where the user has better control of the air flow and condensation build up. The condensation was minimal when I used it though, I just like the two open ended design. Overall though, this tent rocks and you cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyMantz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Is it the sexist backpacking tent out there? I wouldn’t say so, but it’s awesome for the price. I set it up in my living room and even with it not fully secured by stakes, it was surprisingly spacious and comfortable. Fitting two people in here will be a squeeze though. I had a hard time getting it down to the size of a football at first. I ended up stuffing it in the sack willynilly and I was sweating by the time I had it secured. I took it out later to refold it, and got it in the sack correctly. The trick is to neal on it while putting it in the sack. Highly recommend this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: No poles, no problem!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, my 10 year old son bought this tent himself after we researched all the options together and after setting it up immediately for a backyard camp out we are all so impressed! The design is SO ingenious and it held up just fine throughout a very windy day/night. With tents, its always the poles that seem to make it or break it but this tent has no poles making it lighter to pack, more versatile, and very resiliant. We live in PA so there are an abundance of trees and sticks so no poles, no problem. Thank you to whoever finally designed this lightweight tent that makes sense and doesn't break the bank!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent perfect for backpacking only had it up once ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent perfect for backpacking only had it up once to check it out haven't had a chance to use it yet it's been too cold and too much snow and ice using my Kodiak canvas tent right now will update post when I get to use it with better weather
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ritter

customer_reviews.title: 3lbs and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Tent seems pretty good. Setting it up was quick and easy as was taking it down and packing it back up. I'm 6'2" and I fit in it fine. This isn't a tent for cold weather. My intended use of this tent will be in summer. I needed something light weight I could use while backpacking in national forests. Construction seems sturdy. I inspected the stitching and seams, nothing caught my attention; everything looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Differt

customer_reviews.title: Condensation ruins this ideas potential.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - light weight - small/compact - spacious for two ppl and two pups - ease of setup Cons: - the amount of condensation that builds up even with the vents open is unreal! Our sleeping bags and gear were soaked and it literally felt like sleeping in a cave with water dripping down on us even with the vents open. The only remedy is to sleep with the vents open and the front open as well which defeats the purpose of having a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this product. Unfortunately mine came with a tear in one seam (2 inches). Moreover, the condensation problem was a huge draw back. We stay on the North Rim of the Grand Canyon, 35 degrees, and every time your body touched the inside of the tent you became wet. At the bottom of the canyon 85 degrees, it was stifling as there is no air flow; only the front doors are meshed with no windows. Might be great in other areas because it is definitely light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Morse

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof before use
customer_reviews.text: The tent is very lightweight and small when properly put away (fold in half length wise twice and roll, perfect size for provided bag.) When the tent is assembled it is definitely large enough for two people and it almost a luxury for one person. The tent is a single wall tent, I'm assuming to save on weight and pack size so it is recommended to be waterproofed before use. It will hold up to heavy rain for several hours but expect a little water. I would buy this tent again but I have no need for two.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mumau

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent for two people!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights in the Channel Islands and two nights in Yosemite with this tent and loved it! Since we were backpacking we needed something small and lightweight that also was good quality and this tent was it. It fit both of us, our sleeping pads, and sleeping bags comfortably. We also used sticks/trees instead of trekking poles and it was very sturdy. The only downside was when we were sleeping near water it had a ton of condensation on the inside of the tent in the morning. Other than that (which is pretty much unavoidable in any tent) we loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I am also cheap so this tent ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this tent for about 4 months and i have be camping over night about 3 times and i have had it in high winds, moderate snow, and moderate rain. I have had zero problems with this tent. I love it. I am also cheap so this tent is right up my ally.
customer_reviews.author: George hudgens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday and set it up in my living room. Seems like a great tent, just as described. I bought trekking poles to use with it and an excited to give it a try for real on our next campouts. Very easy to set up, my 10 year old can do it. It really is the size of a football, it fit in my mailbox! I thought the package was something else I ordered, not a tent as it was so small. Now I can fit other things in my backpack because this really is small and lightweight. I'm going to check out other products from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size and weight for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent as an emergency shelter to carry in a daypack. I still plan to set it up completely and use a waterproof spray on it. But I have opened it up and practiced rolling it up tight again. The packed size and weight is awesome! I went on a moderate hike last weekend and carried it in my small daypack. My daypack with this tent, a change of clothes, snacks, water, and first aid kit was still only 12 lbs. So it fits exactly what I was wanting it for!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to get into backpacking and for around $50 this was an easy decision. After receiving the tent and setting it up, I am very pleased with it. I think this will work well for spring and fall but I think the tent will be pretty warm for the summer. The bottom liner wraps all the way around and up a little creating a lip which I think will be great if it rains. The only thing that surprised me was the instructions came with how to pack it back up but not how to set it up. Anyway it's not the hard to setup thought.
customer_reviews.author: J. Witmer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed using this tent - would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I have officially used this tent for 4 backpacking trips, ranging from 2 to 4 days each. For the money, you cannot go wrong with the room, convenience, and weight. Only suggesting for the manufacture is to add more ventilation either at the base or back of the tent. It Will condensate on the inside when you close the front rain-fly. I did use it for the last trip (4 days) with the front open with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Cool product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent in the off season. I am a beginning backpack camper. So, this looked like a perfect option for my wife and I. I live in Washington State and am glad to help out a small local business. So far they have demonstrated attention to detail and great customer service. Looking at previous reviews, they have taken that info and improved upon their product by slimming down their stakes to a much lighter aluminum stake. In turn making a more light weight and packable product. I’m giving 4 stars only because I haven’t used it yet. I am excited to try this out come camping season. I will revisit the rating once I have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryanpen

customer_reviews.title: Super light and durable tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent fit in the side pouch of my backpack, is very light, and was warm during the cold nights. Shaved lbs off my other tent and it fit two people pretty comfortably. The lighter weight was by far more optimal for our long multi-day hike. Issues: As everyone has mentioned the condensation built up and left the inside walls pretty wet. To quickly clean for packing, I brought a quick dry towel and just wiped everything down before packing up and let the towel dry on the hike. Overall: Great light tent, very easy and quick to set up, and will continue to use on long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: kevin porzio

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight. Folds nicely and compact. Nice size for a 1 person tent. I had plenty of floor room for my pack, my 85lb golden retriever and myself. Cons: the dip you see in the middle of the tent in the pictures is much more pronounced in real life. Don’t think you’re going to move around or even try to sit up in it. Not gonna happen. I’m 5’7” 185lbs. So not very large. If it rains, it sucks. You’re getting wet. There was dew on the ground in the morning. I woke up wet. I could see the water dripping through the top of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight backpacking tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great. Very lightweight under 3 lbs. Easy to set up and take down and fits in it's bag very well with room to spare and fits nicely in my Osprey 65l backpack just follow the directions. Uses trecking poles to set up. Had rain on my hike on the Trans Catalina Trail and didn't leak at all. No condensation on the inside but outside there was. Great lightweight backpacking tent. So glad I got it. Would highly recommend. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpacking in North Carolina with my son’s scout troop. Tent was very easy to setup and there was plenty of room inside for me and my gear. I didn’t bring a separate rain fly so I had to deal with condensation but otherwise very satisfied. I’m 6’1” and 270lbs so I’m pretty large but felt fine inside. Would advise tying front door to tree instead of trekking poles. It does make it a little difficult to get in and out of with the pole directly in the middle of the door.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Baker

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfect, I'm very happy with this purchase and it's just the right size for 2 people. Does not take up much room and very lightweight. The pegs are a little on the heavy side but I can deal with it. My advise to you is that if you do buy it (which I highly recommend) is that you leave it open with the screen closed because it does not have a whole lot of ventilation. The quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: ramon ramirez jr

customer_reviews.title: Tent leaks.  Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent on a 14 day hiking trip in New Mexico and took care to waterproof it beforehand. Treated it carefully to no avail. The seams on the sides where the tarp like floor sews on leaked any time it rained. There were 2 other tents on the trip which were identical and each of them leaked in the same exact places.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: If you are camping with the scouts do not buy this tent
customer_reviews.text: My sons took this to Philmont scout ranch for a 10 day trek and burned it when they got home. The trekking poles do not hold it up....they had to tie it to trees, and condensation builds up inside and outside the tent because there are only 2 very small windows for ventilation. So, they had water dripping on them every night, for 10 nights. Please do not buy this tent unless you are just camping one night in your backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L Landrum

customer_reviews.title: The tent is ABSOLUTELY PERFECT in conditions WHERE YOU DON'T NEED A TENT - This thing sucks
customer_reviews.text: This damn tent is a reverse water trap and it's absolute garbage. No idea what material they used but it loved trapping moisture inside my tent while keeping the outside bone dry. I had the tent fully open and ventilated and I still kept waking up to ice droplets whipping onto my sleeping bag and soaking it wet in freezing conditions. The stakes only lasted two uses and I had to sharpen sticks just to fashion any kind of shelter. If you're an in an area where rain might be a nice little misting this tent might be alright but at that point carrying a tarp and building a lean-to would be just as effective as this thing.
customer_reviews.author: redsunx

customer_reviews.title: Its raining its pooring, lets stay dry!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent because I'm homeless, and needed some thing to keep my gear, dog, and myself dry. The tent isn't what I was looking for, it builds up too much condensation on the inside, and also leeks at the seems. I let the seller know, and they said I can keep the tent, and they gave me a refund. They where really concerned a bought my well being and asked me if there's any thing I can use or need I give them a full star rating. And the tent it pretty kool too just small to sit in.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only tested this tent in my yard. I was surprised how roomy it was once climbing in. Getting in and out of the tent is a little awkward with the trekking pole in the middle, but I'm used to a traditional tent so that may just be me. I'm sure I'll adapt after a few more uses. Seems like a great tent for the price. I will try to update my review after I take it with me on a backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Huge, strong, light and water-proof
customer_reviews.text: My 12 and 14 year olds used this on a recent bike-packing trip. It's very big, easily fitting two large adults, yet it's very light weight for it's size and price point. We just tried it to trees to hold it up. Anyway, I did buy a spray can of seam sealer and soaked all the seams. This tent helped keep them warm in 40 degree weather. Love it, and will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Free Aluminum Stakes!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Kept me and my gear dry in the rain. It rolls up really small, so both the tent and my sleeping pad fit in the included carrying bag, which straps nicely to the bottom of my backpack. Quick and easy to set up, good design. River Country Products has offered to send me some free aluminum stakes (or extra guyline rope kit) for leaving a review. They say they'll send the gift even if I don't like the tent for any reason, and they accept returns for a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rice

customer_reviews.title: Held up to 40 mph winds
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best tents that I have used. I'm writing this review after my last camping trip January 13, this tent is amazing I told it on a two day camping trip on at the base of the mountain and one at the top it kept me warm in 50° weather and medium winds but when I got to the top of the mountain it was a breeze to set up this tent held up to 40mph wind and sideways rain. This tent is unbelievable the the inside of the tent was dry except for at the vents but sideways rain isn't too kind but I would definitely buy this tent again it's durable
customer_reviews.author: Zachary M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: So far of having this a few months it’s great! Used it when it rained (with a tarp over part of it) and stayed perfectly dry. Kept the heat it, and was easy to pack in and out. Used sticks to hold up the sides as we didn’t have trekking poles and it did the job. Best to bring zip ties tho as those were easier to secure to the sticks than the ties it has.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Sellino

customer_reviews.title: Buy tent sealer!
customer_reviews.text: Solid over all tent, if I had a complaint it would be that the corners where the trekking poles stretch the fabric out, isn't beefy enough. Holes have formed around the stitching in these corners and can allow rain through. To combat this I have loaded tent thread sealer into the afflicted areas. Again this is under normal wear, as I am an experienced camper/hiker and have made no mistakes in the setup and operation of this tent.
customer_reviews.author: K.hezz

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this tent on a 3-day backpacking trip in the Superstition Mountains here in Arizona. It was awesome. Super lightweight, easy to put up and pack and has tons of room. It's made really well and seems like it will hold up well over time. This was my first backpacking trip and so I didn't want to spend a lot of money. Figured I would upgrade if I enjoyed backpacking. Well, I did love backpacking but I'm not upgrading. This tent is legit!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg W

customer_reviews.title: Great tent on a 7 day elk hunt
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent on a 7 day Colorado Elk hunt at 11000ft+. Rain every afternoon sometimes hard rain. I did have a small amount of water leak in dried up easily with a wash cloth. I think it was a bottom seam so I will apply more silicone water proofing to the bottom seams, I think that will help. With the doors open and bug screen in place condensation was at a minimum. I have recommended this tent to several friend already. After the first night using my trekking poles as tent poles I realized I needed the trekking poles so I picked up a couple of sticks and they worked out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: charles bower

customer_reviews.title: I currently use a bivy tent which is nice but sometimes I like some room in the tent
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tent big enough for 2 people that 1- Didn't break the bank and 2- Was lightweight. This tent fit the bill. I haven't tested it in the rain yet. I sprayed it with a waterproof spray. I may use this tent when I hike solo as well. I currently use a bivy tent which is nice but sometimes I like some room in the tent. Switch out the regular stakes with lightweight aluminum stakes and this is one very light and very inexpensive option. I also like the green color.
customer_reviews.author: Nimrod

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The tent with the aluminum stakes comes in at 2 lbs 12 oz. It was super easy to set up with trekking poles and felt like good quality. I have only set it up in my back yard but will use it for the first time on a trip this weekend. It packs smaller, about half the size, than my current backpacking tent with poles. Inside is very roomy. Definitely comfortable for 2 adults. I imagine I can easily fit myself and two if not all three of my children in it as well. So far very happy with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: JBig

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite tent for backpacking. It withstood a storm I had at 6000 ft elevation. Of course, there is always condensation problem with single-walled tents, even after the waterproof spray (the manufacturer claimed otherwise, but I think it really depends on the humidity in the air). Setting up was super easy and fast. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Left foot_Right foot

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I like the tent. For a singlewall tent with a floor, I don't really know you can go too much lighter than this. I do wish that there was a larger air vent in the back of the tent for ventilation. The stakes that come with the tent are ridiculously heavy, but the manufacturer promises to send lighter ones after I leave this review, so we'll see what happens. Supposedly, with the new lighter stakes, the total weight will be reduced to 2lb 12oz.
customer_reviews.author: Yessica A

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is a good small backpacking tent. Love the thick bottom. Well built, water proof for light/medium rain, solid tent stakes. It is a single wall tent, so condensation will build up, even with the venting system. It is a little on the small size for 2 people, especially if your tall. Overall good backpacking tent. I purchased both the 2 & 4 man tents for family backpacking trips. I think the 4 man tent has better value.
customer_reviews.author: Firepower

customer_reviews.title: River Country Trekker 2.2 is the perfect affordable tent for backpackers
customer_reviews.text: I was initially worried about how this tent would hold up in the rain based on previous reviews. I can tell you it did GREAT. The first night I was out on the trail, had a huge storm hit and had inch of hard rain. We stayed perfectly dry. The tent was really easy to setup. Took less than 5 minutes. Very lightweight tent to take on the backpacking trail
customer_reviews.author: mommac

customer_reviews.title: Good for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lightweight tent. It will hold 2 adults and a small kid but is snug for 3. I love the light weight as it makes for a good back packing tent. The floor is durable. It does look about what is pictured when setup. I don't use trexing poles but it is easy to tie to a tree or use a branch for your support. I would recommend this as a back packing tent. It is a simple but decent tent. You can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: PTdash

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tent after watching Dixie's review and comparison to a zpacks. We were very unsure given the price and use of trekking poles. We set up this past weekend in South Dakota and were pleasantly surprised to find it stood against 30mph winds and rain storms with no problem. We had a hit of condensation the second night, but there was no wind and we kept the door flap shut. There was plenty of room for two people and a dog and the weight will be perfect for backpacking!!!
customer_reviews.author: jessb

customer_reviews.title: Super thin
customer_reviews.text: Came In box with what looks like a razor cut and while it did teach me how to fix a tear (had to try a few different methods I learned through trial and error) i don’t know how it would hold up to even a small stick poking a hole. I’ll update this review in a few weeks after I try it out. But it’s a really thin material. I almost would just use a cheap tarp pack from Costco. 2 quality tarps for about 22 bucks out the door. I’m taking my other tarp shelters just incase it fails while out in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: DEREK JAMES ROSS

customer_reviews.title: Light weight.
customer_reviews.text: We love love this tent! We already set it up several times. First time it took us 15 min. After that less the 5 min. Really! Great head space. Enough room for two or three in a pinch. And very lightweight! Planning on section hiking the PCT. I watched a lot of reviews on the big ticket ones and then I found this one. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: SALLY MEDINA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tent for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: T'was a cold fall day, I found myself on the verge of exhaustion and hypothermia. My cigarette was the only source of heat to keep me warm. The smoke dancing like a dancer over my onse, wafting into the stiff, cool air. I needed shelter, fast. In years past, when I found myself in these tribulations, my tent had only failed me. But with River County Products Trekker Tent 2, Trekking pole Tent, Ultralight Backpacking Tent, I lived to hike another day. Supreme comfort, style, and reliable customer cervix saved my life that fateful, frigid, frightful night, and it is with utmost pleasure and admiration that I write this review. Thank you, River Country Products, for giving me life.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Not sexy but effective
customer_reviews.text: The vents need to be modified to give more ventilation, which I did by connecting the vent guys to the ridge guy line. Also I modified the front panels to open and still be able to shed rain when it's warm weather. Saw YouTube video that said the tent was not rain resistant, have had in rain and wind storm with good results. But after seeing the video, did a separate water test in backyard, tent did fine, but the stuff sack was not, which I use for my bear bag, so have sprayed it. It is easy to set up and packs fast.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Y.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up in windy conditions, but secure once it's up.
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent on Mt. Adams. There was high wind and it took several attempts to pitch it, but in the end it stayed up all night. It was a noisy tent in the wind, flapping vigorously all night, but likely any tent would be similar. There was some condensation because it was necessary to close it up tight against the wind. It was very cold outside but I slept warm out of the wind. A zipper pull inside broke off in my hand on first use, so I would recommend to the manufacturer to upgrade to YKK zippers for future production.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Morris

customer_reviews.title: Really hoped this would be a great tent
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this tent because it was the perfect size for backpacking with my dog. It was very light and easily packed in my bag. It was also very spacious on the inside. Unfortunately there was no where near enough ventilation, it was so stuffy inside and the condensation was HORRIBLE. I wish there were more windows so I could see outside the tent. The temp was about 45 and not super humid. The condensation dripped on my dog and I allllll night. It was terrible. It is a really nice tent but I will return because the bad out ways the good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney B.

customer_reviews.title: Football sized tent, great for backpack hiking!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful small and light weight tent. I purchased two of these and have been on the Appalacian Trail with my wife and son. The tent is ideal for what we wanted and you cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Don Griffis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a lightweight tent to use on an overnight hike or 2, and did not want to break the bank. This more than fit the bill. Set it up for first time in backyard in about 10 minutes. Probably will only take about 2-3 minutes tops in woods now that all the lines are untied. Materials feel pretty decent, and plenty of room to sleep in for me and my son, and we are both about 6'2".
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I thru-hiked the PCT with the Big Agnus Fly Creek UL 1. I did not know what to expect quality wise going from a $300 tent to a $50 tent. I have used this this tent on a short backpacking trip now and am impressed with the quality to weight and price ratio. It's not the best or the lightest but for the price I'd say its probably the best value tent. Spacious with plenty of ventilation options. I also highly recommend single wall tents if there is any chance of rain on your trip (this tent is single wall).
customer_reviews.author: Connor Mattson

customer_reviews.title: might as well sleep outside
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this products, its the exact size and shape I wanted. Then I took it out for the first time and had rain. WORST PURCHASE EVER. I was soaked in n hour. Spend the money on quality. This isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry Big Durable Tent
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in the snow and pouring rain and stayed dry. Tones of room. This is a two person tent that can actually hold 2 people snuggly. I am a weekend Scout camper and this has been on 28 trips with only 1 bent stake(my fault and easy fix) that needed to be fixed. I am very careful with my gear.
customer_reviews.author: tinasmile

customer_reviews.title: Very promising tent
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tent because of it's price. My wife & I are getting deeper into backpacking & wanted lighter gear. We already use trekking poles, so this seemed like an obvious choice. The package is very compact & light. I set it up in the garage as I waterproof treat all my tents before use. I was impressed with how big it was for a 2 person tent. Seems most are really just roomy 1 person tents, but this 1 looks to be big enough for the wife & I as well as our gear. Haven't field tested it yet, but the seams appears to be we'll done. 1st impressions are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Inexpensive tent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent for an upcoming back country hunt and intend to live in this for 2 weeks. It might not be the lightest tent on the market but for the price it cant be beat. It seems to be a great quality. set it up in the backyard and had a moderate rain come through, no noticeable leaks. Very easy to set up and had room for all of my gear. I will update after the hunt with some photos.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Q.

customer_reviews.title: Classic tent
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome how compact it is, easy to set up, and the best part is these no poles to carry. Love the classic look and it fits two people just fine. Not sure how it would do in the rain yet. But even with a full can of water repellent spray it still built condensation inside the tent. Still a great lightweight tent for the price. Hope it last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room! Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tent. Perfect for backpacking. It is extremely easy to set up. I had it set up in less than 10 minutes, in the dark. There is lots of room for one person, but it could fit two easily. Word to the wise though, since this is a low weight, low cost tent, there is no rain fly. Make sure you water seal all the seams well. I also recommend sealing all the panels for added protection.
customer_reviews.author: MSB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for an overnight backpacking trip, and I was pleased with the easy set up and take down, as well as the size and style of the tent. I am 5"11 and I could sit up no problem. It is cozy for two people, but it still would be fine for two and not feel too cramped. It was a great purchase for me. I had no problems with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Very big tent for the price and weight
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge and well made. I was shocked at how big this tent is for the price and weight. The floor is well constructed tarp, too. However, at least for me, it's not easy to put up quickly and a lot depends on being able to stake the tent down.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight tent, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent on a 27.11 mile backpacking trip without setting it up or doing any preparation prior. The tent was easy to set up and easy to pack away into its small form. It was small enough and light enough for me, although you could certainly find smaller from other products. It rained both nights that I used the tent, so both the inside and outside of the tent were wet. The condensation seemed to be a pretty big contributor, but regardless waterproofing spray would probably help with this. Overall, it's a solid tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Docteroff

customer_reviews.title: Compact, 3 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I received the tent in good time, and in good condition. I purchased this on a "lightning deal", so I got a good price. The tent packs small, as small as advertised. I weighed it with my scale and came up with 3.0 lbs. Slightly higher than advertised, but the weight included the stake stuff sack as well as the tent stuff sack. Removing these will shed an ounce or two. I haven't used the tent yet, but plan on it for a February overnight in Pennsylvania.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: New to backpacking and used this in the Grand Teton, in a thunderstorm. Held up all night, got a little wet, but not bad. The only problem was there was condensation build up. We were not soaked but the top of our sleeping bag was damp. Sleep me, full size adult, and my nephew that is 9 years old. We had sleep right next to each other, no extra space. Would not recommend for 2 full size adult.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight and Practical
customer_reviews.text: Very light tent, easy and straightforward to set up. Took it out for a long mileage one-nighter and it did everything I could have asked. Didn't rain so can't speak to how well it keeps out water but condensation was not an issue whatsoever. Good breathability. Floor held up fine on rocky soil. Packs very small. Big enough to fit two adults comfortably (at least by backpack tent standards).
customer_reviews.author: Happycamper

customer_reviews.title: Performed beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent for the first time on a one-night camping trip in December, 2018. It was easy to set up and take down. I had no problems with zipper snag. The stake ropes worked easily and stayed tight. The tent seems roomy for a one-person tent. I had no trouble folding the tent into a small size to fit in my backpack. It is also light weight. Using trekking poles saves weight in the backpack as well. The stakes are well designed and never came loose even though other stakes for a hammock setup did. I would recommend this tent, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. It's so easy to set up and take down. Like all single wall tents you can expect a little condensation but it is waterproof. I take this tent backpacking and through hiking all the time and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tent for summer/fall!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent at the beginning of the summer and took it on five or six backpacking trips between June and September. It held up great!! It was surprisingly effective and lightweight considering the low price. After lots of research, I couldn't find anything comparable in quality for this price. When I camped in September, it had quite a bit of condensation, which is normal (especially when it gets colder), but it did result in a rather wet tent and sleeping bag. Overall, it's easy to put up and take down, and it looks great (see picture of tent at Eagle Lake in Alaska).
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We did not get to use it yet because we ended up not needing, but we assembled it to seam seal it for extra protection. It is really nice and lightweight. Very good for the price and weight. I am really happy I got it! Whenever we use it I will update this comment to tell what we think about it in use.
customer_reviews.author: KateAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great item.  Amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Packs small for easy carry. Didn't realize the poles wern't included. No fault of the seller, it was stated. UPDATE: seller read my review and went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied with my purchase. I am extremely happy and will have no reservations doing business with this seller in the future.
customer_reviews.author: RKS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I contacted River Country Products with a repair question after my dog jumped on the tent and ripped it. They went above and beyond in helping me; I'm so impressed and they really believe in their product and want everybody to have a good experience. I had the tent set up in my backyard for four nights after I applied some waterproofing spray---it held up very well to some monsoon afternoon storms. I can't wait to take it up to the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap tent
customer_reviews.text: For the price I've never had a better tent. I would definitely seam seal them and buy new stakes, but I do that with my $500 hiking tents as well. The only downside of this tent is the single direction for air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourn5

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! I bought this for a backpacking trip with my son and was very happy with it. We had to pitch tent the first night in the dark and it was very easy. The other thing I enjoyed about this tent is it is very light! That was the main reason I purchased it and I was more than happy to leave my other $200 plus backpacking tent at home for this one. I do advise the trekking poles for use with this - makes it a lot easier to setup as you don't have to hunt down sticks...
customer_reviews.author: jebright

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Small and compact
customer_reviews.text: This went up so quick and easy - perfect for two not-large people. The tarp layer on the bottom does seem a little thin and I wonder how it would do after many uses, but it was perfect for packing light for a couple nights of hiking. We did NOT get the poles. As long as you camp near trees, you don't need them.
customer_reviews.author: TamL

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet - but sure I'll love it.
customer_reviews.text: Not my lightest weight tent, but roomier than my others so I didn't expect it to be as light. Looking forward to using it. Looks sturdy. Was fairly easy to practice putting up in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Sue and Ron

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to waterproof the tent with a spray. And set it up a few times before taking it out.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the design of this tent. Unfortunately the first one I recieved had a leak. But I contacted the company and they replaced it for me. With no problem. No questions asked. The new tent I received is great. It has a full bathtub style floor that is made of pretty durable material. I strap this to the outside of my backpack. For the money you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Backcountry Runaway

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent, quick and easy to set up, would be even better had I purchased some trekking poles. It is of good quality material and worksmanship, sealed seams and have not found any loose stitching at all. One of my requirements for this tent was that it had to be able to fit a twin sized air mattress, it does with room to spare. Could easily fit two people in here with a backpack each. Overall im happy and feel it will do its job well for an upcoming trip to the national forest. Absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing backpacking tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is absolutely fantastic for backpack camping. It is the smallest tent I could find(packed down), especially for the money. Smaller than a football! And great size for 2 people when set up, if you don't mind getting a bit cozy. Perfectly fine for friends and family. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Starter tent
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price point. You would have to be the Incredible Hulk to pack it down to football size, but stuff sack is plenty big enough. To have two people sleep in it, you will be against the wall. I sprayed with water repellent, but still had some water inside after a hard rain.
customer_reviews.author: Slone

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy so far with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This tent cost about the equivalent of the pt I'm using in my cook setup. I purchased this tent solely due to weight and price. I'm new to backpacking and wanted my initial investment to be conservative until I could determine if this is activiry that I will enjoy. It arrived and performs as described. It's roomy and appears to be good quality build. Completed waterproofing process, spray, seams are tape sealed. Backyard overnight at 53 degrees (Texas) was good. Will update review after several trials in various types of weather on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Brigando

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the size and weight
customer_reviews.text: I set this tent up on the beach to treat with permetherin and seam sealer, and to get accustomed to setting it up before setting it up in the wild. As many others have said, its a solid and basic tent. I will post an update if necessary after my first backpacking trip. Pros: - Durable tarp bathtub type floor-- no footprint necessary - Lightweight Cons: - Several guylines required - Some seams were not taped/treated, and there are very small holes in each corner of the tarp floor as another reviewer showed in their pictures - Stakes included are heavy for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Christodoulou

customer_reviews.title: Yeah buy it
customer_reviews.text: $50ish for a two person, lightweight tent with no poles. Not possible? I'd say yeah, yeah it is. If you're looking to buy this you might be just starting out with backpacking or camping, same here! I took the chance after reading other comments and I'm super happy with it. It's roomy, it took me like 4 minutes to set up the first time, and doesnt take up a lot of space in my bag because my trekking poles are the main support. Now, I haven't been through a rainy night with it, maybe you have to spend a little time and money sealing the seams on the outside. That's just the price you pay for a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Colton M.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a great pack tent I am a hammock camper but I had a opportunity to back pack through Arizona and New Mexico this past fall Not a lot of trees to hang a hammock Got this tent and it served me very well wth heat and rain
customer_reviews.author: Toxikviper

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent, more than enough room for 2 people, and setup is painless. First camping trip we set it up and sprayed it with tent spray to help waterproof it but the water did still come through it, if it wasnt for that it would be a 5 star for me, will try spraying it again next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: motorycle camping
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. Took maybe 5 minutes. Its a little short but perfect for hiking or motorcycle camping! Great ventilation. Easy zippers. We love it and will be getting a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget tent
customer_reviews.text: Recently used this tent for six nights of backpacking. Love the ingenious idea of using trekking poles as tent poles! I kept the tent door open 5 of the nights and it remained completely dry inside. One night it rained lightly so I closed the tent door and condensation developed - which wasn't surprising. I didn't use a footprint and found the bottom of the tent to be very durable. Overall, it's hard to beat a tent this portable and lightweight for the pricepoint - very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Easy tent to use
customer_reviews.text: Just finished a 4 day backpacking trip to the Wallowa Mts. in Oregon. Tent worked well. Light and easy to set up with my hiking poles. I had the 2-person model and liked its roominess. Applied sealant per company's recommendation and had no problems with condensation. I would have liked to have had a small vestibule to place my boots. I have yet to use it with rain or damp conditions where the tent could be fully tested and rated.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel Swayze

customer_reviews.title: Actually fits two people!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic backpacking tent. I love its size - two people and their gear really will fit comfortably in it. The materials used are sturdy and set up is a breeze. I have a love/hate relationship with the color. I love that it blends in with the woods, but it does feel a little bit dark inside. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent a few months ago, it is a nice size tent but the ventilation is not so great. I did contact the seller River County Products and they are extremely helpful and they informed me they came out with a new design with bigger vents so I suggest that you go check that one out. I did give this four stars because of the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. It also comes with 8 ultra light aluminum stakes. 6 pieces of para cord, about 4ft in length with the plastic loop buckle on one end. It's a simple set up. Roomy inside, about 66" accross inside. I did a quick setup in my yard when I got it, and took some pictures. Comes with instructions that are easy to follow if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

product_meta.title: River Country Products Trekker Tent 2, Trekking Pole Tent, Ultralight Backpacking Tent
feature_bullets: Super fast and easy set up! Great for hiking, camping, or adding to your survival bag, this compact tent will fit into your backpack without filling it up.
Great one-person and gear tent or two-person tent without gear.

Trekking poles are NOT included (they are included in the Trekker Tent 2 Combo pack also on Amazon @ https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07BNQXKDN ), this tent is intended for use with your own trekking poles, but can be used with almost any stick that is over 42 inches tall.
At 7 feet long and 5 feet wide, and 42 inches tall, this tent offers more room inside than almost any other ultralight tent.
The Trekker Tent 2 weighs just 2lbs 12oz. Tent comes with stakes and carry bag.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
